reviews.text:
üêøÔ∏èSquirrel Trail is a short trail consisting of boardwalk and cobblestone pathways.
ü¶®The Trail run parallel to Venus Link, and along freshwater stream and pond surrounding so it can get a little tricky during wet days.
üêøÔ∏èVistors are likely to meet squirrels along the trail.
ü¶®Hike along the Squirrel Trail and immerse its rich flora diversity.

Great side trail that goes parallel to the Venus walk, partially a boardwalk, partially ground-level, with large stones going amidst the swamp/wetland area. Can be inaccessible after rain due to flooding.
There are plenty of butterflies, dragonflies, small fish, and squirrels present (sometimes be wary that they are eating something in the trees above you!)
Went for a hike towards the treetop walk and found this lovely trail. I saw a few squirrels and a monkey or 2. Do note that some parts can get flooded during heavy rain.
Nice trail for observing wildlife, with many squirrels running up and down trees. Lots of space and very well maintained.

This is a vast garden. There is many flowers and towering trees offering flora and fauna. The ground is well paved and clean. As its name suggests, it has many squirrels. Admire the cute squirrels nibbling on walnuts and see them jumping from one tree trunk to another. There is also a small serene stream and its water is cold. A scenic and picturesque place perfect to cycle, jog or to breathe in the fresh air.
